caption: Small museum but no crowds at all. You start the visit with second floor, which is very much text and photo based. Then you go to first floor which is where Clemenceau used to live, and I think this is the interesting part of the museum. It is a very subjective museum though, it doesn't portray Clemenceau with both his positives and negatives but pretty much only positives. This must be because the museum is found and run by the Clemenceau foundation.

A little jewel of a museum. Well kept with lots of interesting news about Cl√©menceau: anti-colonialist  arduous defender of Dreyfus, Minister of War during WWI. One can see his bedroom where nothing has changed since his death. Well worth a visit.

This is a museum where Georges Clemenceau, the French Prime Minister during World War I, lived in an actual apartment from 1896 to his death. On the first floor there are records about him (newspapers, paintings, letters etc), and on the ground floor you can see the dining room, bedroom, bureau and garden.  He is known for his distinctive mustaches and photographs of tigers and Clemenceau's words below the museum paintings stand out.  <<Il faut savoir ce que l'on veut. Quand on le sait, il faut avoir le courage de le dire. Et quand on le dit, il faut avoir le courage de le faire.>> (You have to know what you want. When you know it, you have to have the courage to say it. And when we say, you have to have the courage to do it.)  It is not large, so it takes about 20 minutes to look around, and it is recommended to check the website in advance as the museum is often closed depending on circumstances.
Lovely little museum worth a visit!
Really impressive. It is a trip in time and an opportunity to have an insight to the life of one of France‚Äôs greatest politicians. It is really worth to visit.
A Wonderful, dedicated museum. Time Capsule + wealth of information. Try to see a conference about Clemenceau (app 1 hour, very insightful)
Wow
Beautiful!!!

I recommend this very interesting museum.  Upstairs there is an exhibition on Cl√©menceau, objects and short films. On the ground floor his apartment with rooms like his bedroom which remained as they were when he died in 1929. It reminds you that you are only a small thing. The man is dead but his glasses and his newspaper are still there. And his mules are under the bed. I advise you to take the audio guide. It's her niece who tells you about her life with anecdotes from her own mother.  I had a great time.

Very pleasant and interesting discovery of the Cl√©menceau museum! Here is a historic Parisian place that is little known but deserves to be. This is where Georges Clemenceau lived from 1896 until his death on November 24, 1929, and since that date nothing has changed! Which is what makes this museum so charming. On the ground floor, his (small) four-room apartment with adjoining garden (incredible to think that at the time this member of the middle bourgeoisie still had a valet, a cook and a driver at his service) . And on the first floor a permanent exhibition clearly retraces the key stages of the Tiger's life in the style of "his life, his work" in particular his careers as a journalist, politician, collector (great interest for Japan and Greece antique), artist and writer. A little hagiographic in ignoring its gray areas (Panama affair, strike breaker in violence and repression of social struggles, quarrels with Jules Ferry, Gambetta or Jaur√®s, incarceration of his wife for adultery then expulsion as a foreigner convicted of an offense of common law to the United States, with a third class ticket, and obtaining so that she loses custody of her children and French nationality...) but it is the law of the genre in this type of museum.

Very nice visit! A warm and efficient welcome, an attractive synthetic, multimedia exhibition gallery upstairs and on the garden level, the heritage apartment in very good condition! All this around a key character in our history, who covered all the major subjects, colonization, secularism, public order, technical progress and social transformation, the arts, etc. We know Clemenceau's words, implacable, sharp, chiseled, to the point that the man appears austere and intimidating. The place recalls all of this but also reveals the sensitivity of the hidden man, his taste for Japan, the garden, reading. He had enemies but he was able to attract excellent friends and behave with infinite loyalty himself. We owe him a lot in preserving the work of Claude Monet for example. I wrote a complete article aimed primarily at history-geography teachers: https://www.clionautes.org/le-musee-clemenceau.html

As a Parisian, I was born and lived here, and I know Paris very well. I can say that the apartment of General le Tigre Clemenceau, even if it seems small from the outside, is one of the most beautiful heritage apartments in Paris. . I love the smell of history there, its unique bathroom, its rare and unique office, everything. The details are very beautiful, the woodwork, the garden, it is the jewel of the Passy district, a stone's throw from the house of my favorite writer Honor√© de Balzac, I advise you to visit this magnificent apartment. I hope that the books in the Tiger's private library will be maintained and cataloged, as some of them are outdated. I thank the two ladies (guides) very much, they are wonderful, very polite and I talked to them well.

The museum is located near the Trocad√©ro in Cl√©menceau's apartment.  The visit is in two parts and begins on the 1st floor by the public man and ends on the ground floor in the private apartment and garden. The staff is very welcoming, the audio guide is provided to discover the intimate life of a learned man, a great reader with a simple daily life. A cloakroom is available, very practical.
Extremely interesting museum! Favorite for Cl√©menceau's apartment on the ground floor which has been left as is since his death in 1929. A real journey through time!

The Clemenceau museum is very intimate with pieces intact since his death in 1929. A great character in the history of FRANCE üá´üá∑ Thank you to the two young women present during my visit for their kindness. üëèüèªüò∏ I highly recommend!!!

The House-Museum of Georges Cl√©menceau also called "Father Victory" includes 2 parts Museum on the 1st floor: - his personal life; his marriage, divorce, his unwavering friendship with Claude Monet, his collections, his travels, etc.... - his professional career as a doctor, then politics with testimonies, photos, stories, travels, etc... Ground floor: We enter the intimate life of Georges Cl√©menceau who lived in this apartment from 1896 until his death on November 24, 1929. We see: - the bathroom and the scale on the floor, because he weighed himself every morning, - the room with his dressing gown, his slippers, and above all the calendar fixed on November 24, 1929, the day of his death. - his large office where he received VIPs, etc. The visit is interesting, because an audio guide accompanies us in each of the rooms. The detailed explanations make the whole thing more alive. The visit ends in the garden of which he had exclusive use.

House / Museum. On the first floor is the museum. On the ground floor is CLEMENCEAU's apartment, exactly as it was when he died. Very interesting visit. You will be fully immersed in the private life of ‚ÄúDu Tigre‚Äù.
Nice little museum. Low price. Works in the courtyard but museum accessible. The living rooms allow you to get into the mood. And upstairs the exhibition presents things in a more contemporary way.

Impressive, very interesting. I discovered the life of Cl√©menceau. We know his political career, but his life was very rich culturally... A TV film is currently being filmed on his life and will be released on France 2
Magical, historic place. The welcome at the top. We have the impression that Cl√©menceau is still there.

It is absolutely necessary to visit this discreet place, splendidly furnished, decorated, calm and above all well documented, presenting a historical character with multiple talents, a doctor-historian, journalist-translator-novelist and not only frozen in a narrow image of Minister Tiger, but with humanism open to the social and the art of the time.  A complete man including the ordinary faults that we forget in the face of so much talent.

A museum that deserves to be known, especially since the Tiger is still a famous character in our History. Very nice apartment... I had the impression that Clemenceau was going to appear and put his hand on my shoulder. I loved it even though in a hurry due to closing time I couldn't wander around...

Charming little museum located in the courtyard building of a building, the apartment is on the ground floor with period furniture and a small garden, the visit continues on the first floor where the temporary exhibition is located as well as a few rooms on the history of Clemenceau. The reception is on the ground floor and some souvenirs where books are on sale, welcoming and available staff.
It's a place that I discovered. A friend is a descendant of the cartoonist Sem, and he ‚Äúsketched‚Äù the Tiger!
The apartment of this great statesman has been preserved as he occupied it. A dive into History ‚ÄºÔ∏è
Very nice visit to this exhibition apartment on 2 floors.  Small garden, apartment steeped in history, paid entrance 6th. To see everything is in good condition. Very moving. To see with children

absolutely worth visiting! the visit to the apartment is moving because it is as if Georges Cl√©menceau had just left. The museum upstairs is very interesting and informative. In addition, we are very well received. I will return with pleasure to visit the section on ‚ÄúCl√©menceau and sport‚Äù which will be offered.
Beautiful apartment. in a magnificent area. small admirable garden. wonderful memories on the ground floor. beautiful history lesson on the 1st floor.

Magnificent museum which really touched me. Everything remains as it was then. This museum sincerely deserves to be better known. Don't hesitate to go there, it's close to the Trocad√©ro. The guides are very nice.
House of Georges Cl√©menceau to discover! A character and a moment of history

Great discovery! This is the first time I've visited a museum by ringing the doorbell and having someone come and open it for me üòÑ! On the 1st floor, his life and works are well explained (political, literary, social, military, etc.). The part on the ground floor is moving since everything has remained as it was on the day of his death: the last letter he was writing. The audio guide made by his niece is full of interesting anecdotes. There are also paintings by Monet and busts offered by Rodin... His friends. In short, a journey through time that allows us to rediscover the Tiger üêØ!!

Very interesting museum, in two parts. First a part recounting the life of Clemenceau and then the apartment in which he lived, which remained as is. I particularly liked the garden, very pleasant in the middle of the city.
A place rich in historical and artistic discoveries which allows you to better understand and above all get to know one of the essential politicians in the history of France.

Thanks to its very well designed scenography and numerous supporting objects, the museum retraces the life of Clemenceau. We then find ourselves immersed in his apartment where nothing seems to have changed. It‚Äôs an exceptional place! Thank you to the staff for their welcome.
This museum is very interesting!!!
Hello, in the exhibition it is marked that Clemenceau was not under the Second Empire (panels on his biography) but in 1841 Louis-Philippe reigned....Can you enlighten me THANKS
Magnificent museum, where you learn a lot about the life of a great man.
Small, quiet museum with its hidden garden. Historical explanations upstairs then diving into the preserved apartment on the ground floor: we are transported on a journey through time....
